Instrument.name: Lunar Reconnaissance Orbiter Lunar Exploration Neutron Detector
Instrument.description: The Lunar Reconnaissance Orbiter (LRO) Lunar Exploration Neutron Detector (LEND) is a large orbital neutron telescope for mapping the Moon's neutron albedo. LEND is the follow-on instrument from the High Energy Neutron Detector (HEND) onboard Mars Odyssey, although LEND incorporates a set of collimated detectors to improve spatial resolution. LEND has eight 3He sensors for detecting thermal and epithermal neutrons. Four of the 3He sensors are un-collimated and four are collimated. The LEND instrument is based on the registration of secondary neutrons from the Moon, which are created in the upper 1-2 meters of lunar regolith which is irradiated by cosmic rays. LEND operates autonomously, collecting data throughout the lunar orbit.
